commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibec69488cb1ea81ff3a197e95efe3810a076f27d

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support. Removing the py36 centos8 job as well as

commit_message:
Use hacluster.add_location()

This change removes the workaround that was needed when the hacluster
interface didn't have a method to define colocations.

Related-Bug: #1880644
Change-Id: I4236cb4784062807d53381380d9d161ce2f450ee
(cherry picked from commit f2d9ed37090607676c5c6b54ea797c55e228d2af)

subject: [keystone] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-05 14:19:52.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/zed/python-keystoneclient.yaml', 'deliverables/zed/keystonemiddleware.yaml', 'deliverables/zed/keystoneauth.yaml'], 'message': '[keystone] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs

This creates the stable/zed branch for all client and non-client
libraries now that we are past the lib freeze on September 1st.

If the team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the
library, someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or
update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 9th.

Change-Id: Ic5abc6283901d75d4938d2308875964f2687ca2d
'}]
commit_message:
[keystone] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs

This creates the stable/zed branch for all client and non-client
libraries now that we are past the lib freeze on September 1st.

If the team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the
library, someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or

commit_message:
Add ceph mgr capabilities

Without this change, manila's cephfs driver results in
manilaclient.common.apiclient.exceptions.Forbidden:
Access was denied to this resource. (HTTP 403)
when running rados commands.

http://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/mgr/administrator/#client-authentication

Closes-Bug: #1952763
Closes-Bug: #1962204

Change-Id: I6ad5047fff2f3109a9efe1f03a786ce0412b4161
(cherry picked from commit 496bfd569b000bdaa7d16b61afdb069ec959c076)

commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/victoria

- start from stable/victoria branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/victoria for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 20.04 amd64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: I988b126284b994a03a3a0f84fc67d932d35201e4

subject: Replace testing template with individual jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-08-17 14:31:23.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Replace testing template with individual jobs

Being on an independent release model, rbd-iscsi-client supports
more pythons than are supported by current openstack development,
so adjust the zuul and tox config to reflect this.

Also temporarily makes the pep8 job non-voting so this change
can be merged.  The pep8 job is fixed and restored to voting by
change Ia4d40a85ac15.

Change-Id: I0042e16d19e133546b0384fec5a6aee1701eda28
'}]
commit_message:
Replace testing template with individual jobs

Being on an independent release model, rbd-iscsi-client supports
more pythons than are supported by current openstack development,
so adjust the zuul and tox config to reflect this.

Also temporarily makes the pep8 job non-voting so this change
can be merged.  The pep8 job is fixed and restored to voting by
change Ia4d40a85ac15.

Change-Id: I0042e16d19e133546b0384fec5a6aee1701eda28

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-20 03:25:55.000000000', 'files': ['osci.yaml', '.gitignore', '.gitreview', 'test-requirements.txt', 'Makefile', 'config.yaml', 'tests/bundles/xenial-queens.yaml', 'charm-helpers-hooks.yaml', 'tests/bundles/xenial-pike.yaml', 'tests/bundles/bionic-rocky.yaml', 'tests/bundles/bionic-queens.yaml', 'tests/bundles/focal-victoria.yaml', 'tests/bundles/hirsute-wallaby.yaml', 'tests/bundles/focal-wallaby.yaml', 'tests/bundles/focal-ussuri.yaml', 'tests/bundles/xenial-ocata.yaml', 'build-requirements.txt', 'tests/bundles/bionic-ussuri.yaml', 'tests/bundles/xenial-mitaka.yaml', 'tests/bundles/bionic-stein.yaml', 'tests/bundles/groovy-victoria.yaml', 'tests/bundles/bionic-train.yaml', 'tests/bundles/trusty-mitaka.yaml', 'tests/tests.yaml', 'tests/bundles/focal-xena.yaml', 'rename.sh', 'charmcraft.yaml', 'metadata.yaml', 'tox.ini', 'tests/bundles/impish-xena.yaml'], 'message': "Charmhub migration stable/octopus

Add charmhub migration for stable/octopus including:

- start from the stable/octopus branch
- Add charmcraft.yaml
- osci.yaml updates
- Fetch from stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - zaza
  - zaza.openstack.tests
- charms.ceph pull from stable/octopus
- remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub format (ch: prefix + channels)
- build on 18.04 amd64
- run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- default source to 'ussuri'

Change-Id: I01345b7880a71a15370074d35a9eddb7e5590ee7
"}]
commit_message:
Charmhub migration stable/octopus

Add charmhub migration for stable/octopus including:

- start from the stable/octopus branch
- Add charmcraft.yaml
- osci.yaml updates
- Fetch from stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - zaza
  - zaza.openstack.tests
- charms.ceph pull from stable/octopus
- remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub format (ch: prefix + channels)
- build on 18.04 amd64
- run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- default source to 'ussuri'

Change-Id: I01345b7880a71a15370074d35a9eddb7e5590ee7

subject: Fix stopping stopped instances
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2022-09-09 11:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/tests/unit/engine/drivers/taskflow/test_instance_failure_flow.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1980736-975ee013e4612062.yaml', 'masakari/engine/drivers/taskflow/instance_failure.py'], 'message': 'Fix stopping stopped instances

Nova-compute would periodically sync the instance status. So in the
instance failure recovery workflow,it would stop instance random failed
because of conflict, which will terminate the recovery workflow.
This patch can catch the Confict exception and continue the recovery
workflow if the instance already stopped.

Closes-Bug: 1980736
Change-Id: I59a1f9d7078614c1ddc8f4c362e967a15b8ec5e8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix stopping stopped instances

Nova-compute would periodically sync the instance status. So in the
instance failure recovery workflow,it would stop instance random failed
because of conflict, which will terminate the recovery workflow.
This patch can catch the Confict exception and continue the recovery
workflow if the instance already stopped.

Closes-Bug: 1980736
Change-Id: I59a1f9d7078614c1ddc8f4c362e967a15b8ec5e8

subject: Do not guess content from extension on API
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-09-09 08:41:03.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/api/app.py'], 'message': "Do not guess content from extension on API

When getting a cron trigger (but also any other object) by name, pecan
core will try to guess the content_type from the extension.
While for most name, the guess will fail, it may succeed, e.g. when a
name is ending with '.pl'.
Pecan guess it as a perl file and then reject the call (with a 404
error).

The fix is to tell pecan to not guess any content_type from extension by
setting guess_content_type_from_ext to False on initialisation.

Closes-Bug: 1987418

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: I1bc20b953787cae9b42d12bb5eb3c7a94ed4bbdd
"}]
commit_message:
Do not guess content from extension on API

When getting a cron trigger (but also any other object) by name, pecan
core will try to guess the content_type from the extension.
While for most name, the guess will fail, it may succeed, e.g. when a
name is ending with '.pl'.
Pecan guess it as a perl file and then reject the call (with a 404
error).

The fix is to tell pecan to not guess any content_type from extension by
setting guess_content_type_from_ext to False on initialisation.

Closes-Bug: 1987418

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: I1bc20b953787cae9b42d12bb5eb3c7a94ed4bbdd

subject: Fix race condition when comparing dates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-09 08:41:03.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_task_started_finished_at.py'], 'message': 'Fix race condition when comparing dates

A test is randomly failing due to a comparison between two dates:
created_at and started_at.
Most of the time these two dates are identical, but we can have one
second difference when the creation is done at the very end of a second
and the start is done at the beginning of the next one.

The fix is to make sure that we have less or equal than 1 sec between
started_at and created_at.

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: I081bb659047f7639bed52dfac8b3858b10859404
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition when comparing dates

A test is randomly failing due to a comparison between two dates:
created_at and started_at.
Most of the time these two dates are identical, but we can have one
second difference when the creation is done at the very end of a second
and the start is done at the beginning of the next one.

The fix is to make sure that we have less or equal than 1 sec between
started_at and created_at.

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: I081bb659047f7639bed52dfac8b3858b10859404

subject: [cloudkitty] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-05 14:42:48.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/zed/python-cloudkittyclient.yaml'], 'message': '[cloudkitty] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs

This creates the stable/zed branch for all client and non-client
libraries now that we are past the lib freeze on September 1st.

If the team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the
library, someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or
update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 9th.

Change-Id: I68eee2c0d57db1e1926e8edb17b55d039c757298
'}]
commit_message:
[cloudkitty] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs

This creates the stable/zed branch for all client and non-client
libraries now that we are past the lib freeze on September 1st.

If the team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the
library, someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or
update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 9th.

Change-Id: I68eee2c0d57db1e1926e8edb17b55d039c757298

commit_message:
Rewrite actions/copy_pool into the oeprator framework

In addition to trivial changes (passing `event` into
the `copy_pool` function), this change introduces an
update to the actions/__init__.py that allows succinct
import and use from the main charm.py.

An apparently unrelated change is the removal of
charm-proof from the lint job, as it fails with the
removal of actions/copy-pool.

Change-Id: I66a5590ddf0f0bb5ca073a91b451f8c78598609a
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/866

subject: Fix race condition when cancelling workflows
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-08-30 08:45:04.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_workflow_cancel.py'], 'message': 'Fix race condition when cancelling workflows

Some tests which are cancelling workflows are also checking that only one task
was executed.
But the second task is delayed (wait-before: 3) so we can endup in a
situation when the second task appeared in the task_execs.

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: I425b5ca0c1bedc22db1aa464f5f14aae69f9370e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition when cancelling workflows

Some tests which are cancelling workflows are also checking that only one task
was executed.
But the second task is delayed (wait-before: 3) so we can endup in a
situation when the second task appeared in the task_execs.

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: I425b5ca0c1bedc22db1aa464f5f14aae69f9370e

commit_message:
privsep: Add support for the remaining parameters

This change adds support for the following two parameters of
the oslo.privsep library, so that all options can be configured by
the oslo::privsep defined resource type.

 - thread_pool_size
 - logger_name

Change-Id: I88eb0a5a1d3fd795a2c29b7be4d6e5722a330c45

subject: [OpenStackSDK] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-09-05 14:27:58.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/zed/cliff.yaml', 'deliverables/zed/osc-lib.yaml', 'deliverables/zed/openstacksdk.yaml'], 'message': '[OpenStackSDK] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs

This creates the stable/zed branch for all client and non-client
libraries now that we are past the lib freeze on September 1st.

If the team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the
library, someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or
update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 9th.

Change-Id: Idc023735b3bff9e9fb1410a8138a2220d596a4b1
'}]
commit_message:
[OpenStackSDK] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs

This creates the stable/zed branch for all client and non-client
libraries now that we are past the lib freeze on September 1st.

If the team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the
library, someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or
update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 9th.

Change-Id: Idc023735b3bff9e9fb1410a8138a2220d596a4b1

commit_message:
Replace redundant hard-code of [libvirt] inject_*

The current default values are same as the defaults defined in Nova,
thus can be replaced by $::os_service_default .

Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
mlnx: Allow workaround for duplicate resources

The commit b2e7de79df98a986768aaef203ddbe02bee41072 , which was merged
during Train cycle, introduced a few new parameters to support multi
interface driver, but the following two parameters are already declared
in the corresponding agent classes and trigger duplicate resource
declaration when these classes are used in a single manifest.
 - dhcp_broadcast_reply
 - interface_driver

This change allows users to workaround the problem. Details are
documented in the release note.

Closes-Bug: #1987460
Change-Id: I993523dc7f0ec8ad90a50d049dc0f5ccf9f2b191
(cherry picked from commit c4f3abe22e5f57a03c5953f0b342433d93f36731)
(cherry picked from commit 49bfd89810d85dccd658ea9f16480c679d5955d1)

commit_message:
Add negative FT for subscription in multi tenancy

In a multi-tenant environment, the user's request to show
or delete subscription of a different tenant, must fail.

This patch adds negative functional test cases for subscription
show and delete operation.

Implements: bp enhance-multi-tenant-policy
Change-Id: Ie44116364089e06c86e4c3dcd207c5a720e6e4a4

commit_message:
Ensure pymemcache library is installed

The pymemcache library should be installed when pymemcache backend is
used but this library is not installed by the package dependencies and
should be installed additionally.

This also ensures the cache libraries are installed during package
installation phase, so that the libraries are available when horizon
is started.

Closes-Bug: #1988205
Change-Id: I90cd9d9e1276fae71fcb9cbc7ba95b8839690dbd
(cherry picked from commit 5660159a6e2237c8bcdc66167873b6534da1d935)

subject: Fix type validation warning for storage policy rings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-25 07:51:45.000000000', 'files': ['spec/defines/swift_ringbuilder_create_spec.rb', 'manifests/ringbuilder/create.pp', 'manifests/ringbuilder/rebalance.pp', 'spec/defines/swift_ringbuilder_rebalance_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Fix type validation warning for storage policy rings

Since 63688a14e57282ae97072b406c81d0da2f61965c was merged, this module
support configuring storage policies.

When multiple storage policies are used, we need to create multiple
object rings like object.ring.gz, object-1.ring.gz. However the current
regexp to validate the ring name does not consider this format and
shows the type validation warning when creating a non-default policy
rings.

This change updates the regexp used in validation to accept that
object-<number> format as well.

Closes-Bug: #1987260
Change-Id: Ibc7479e7defbfa4c49bf3c9f1574cdcf61b90ab9
(cherry picked from commit 11b193cab8f880f1b73c57208646a889979e6fd8)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix type validation warning for storage policy rings

Since 63688a14e57282ae97072b406c81d0da2f61965c was merged, this module
support configuring storage policies.

When multiple storage policies are used, we need to create multiple
object rings like object.ring.gz, object-1.ring.gz. However the current
regexp to validate the ring name does not consider this format and
shows the type validation warning when creating a non-default policy
rings.

This change updates the regexp used in validation to accept that
object-<number> format as well.

Closes-Bug: #1987260
Change-Id: Ibc7479e7defbfa4c49bf3c9f1574cdcf61b90ab9
(cherry picked from commit 11b193cab8f880f1b73c57208646a889979e6fd8)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-08-29 14:51:29.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/placement.pp'], 'message': 'Ubuntu: Purge the default policy.yaml for Placement

The policy.yaml file provided by the UCA package contains wrong
modifications since Xena, which is causing consistent API error.

This change makes sure the file is purged in Ubuntu to workaround
the problem. This change will be reverted once the package file is
fixed.

Related-Bug: #1987984
Change-Id: I9e6e91c065f994433c9b92d9b84e7c1e6d61f3e5
(cherry picked from commit 71197c85813f400043e5dbf4106b2e127a980a1e)
'}]
commit_message:
Ubuntu: Purge the default policy.yaml for Placement

The policy.yaml file provided by the UCA package contains wrong
modifications since Xena, which is causing consistent API error.

This change makes sure the file is purged in Ubuntu to workaround
the problem. This change will be reverted once the package file is
fixed.

Related-Bug: #1987984
Change-Id: I9e6e91c065f994433c9b92d9b84e7c1e6d61f3e5
(cherry picked from commit 71197c85813f400043e5dbf4106b2e127a980a1e)

commit_message:
cache: Add inet6 prefix for only memcached backends

The inet6 prefix is required only by backends dependent on
python-memcached and SHOULD NOT be added when the other backends like
pymemcache backend are used.

Closes-Bug: #1965318
Change-Id: I351bd1f291b9e948cb73592a5a742d051a048d00
(cherry picked from commit 95544711d4751a6dee6fee25a2695604094d31ca)

commit_message:
Fix missing parameters for heat-tempest-plugin

heat-tempest-plugin requires a few parameters in the dedicated
[heat_plugin] section. This change adds initial support for these
parameters  so that heat-tempest-plugin tests can be executed properly.

commit_message:
[cinder] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs

This creates the stable/zed branch for all client and non-client
libraries now that we are past the lib freeze on September 1st.

If the team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the
library, someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or
update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 9th.

Change-Id: I8d20807bfe561cee8c3982df11de3919680ec55c

commit_message:
[swift] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs

This creates the stable/zed branch for all client and non-client
libraries now that we are past the lib freeze on September 1st.

If the team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the
library, someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or
update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 9th.

Change-Id: Ic7d9fdbbf81f59fc4346dbb9bfdeeb05f07ff548

This commit creates the final release for ironic-ui in Zed cycle

commit_message:
Release IPA-Builder for Zed

This is the release for ironic-python-agent-builder in the Zed Cycle
It also creates the stable branch for it.

* ddbd659 2022-08-27 16:14:06 +0800 remove unicode prefix from code
* 3272b54 2022-06-20 14:08:49 +0200 Document building an image with patches
| * cd34086 2022-05-18 09:48:49 +0200 Remove support for openSUSE since Python 3.6 is no longer supported
|/
| * 020c4b3 2022-07-06 11:29:15 +0200 Remove CentOS Stream 8 leftovers
| * 57f50f7 2022-06-27 10:27:43 +0100 Add smartmontools package to DIB image
|/
| * 43f2eae 2022-06-23 16:07:51 -0700 Remove some extra Centos Packages
|/
* d543aa8 2022-05-13 12:25:25 +0200 Remove support for distributions with Python 3.6
* e5bf43c 2022-04-04 21:10:10 -0300 Add multipath-io element
* 835f648 2022-03-22 15:52:57 +0000 Update master for stable/yoga

Change-Id: I9960e8355f6d79ac816bc07d6e7feb1fb15b364e

subject: Unify resource list filtering
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-09-06 11:41:05.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/test_resource.py', 'openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/proxy.py', 'openstack/cloud/_compute.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/cloud/_security_group.py', 'openstack/compute/v2/flavor.py'], 'message': 'Unify resource list filtering

Extend resource list method to accept all possible filtering parameters.
What is supported by the API are sent to the server. Remaining
parameters are applied to the fetched results. With this
`allow_unknown_params` parameter of the list call is dropped.

Change-Id: Ie9cfb81330d6b98b97b7abad9cf5ae6334ba12e7
'}]
commit_message:
Unify resource list filtering

Extend resource list method to accept all possible filtering parameters.
What is supported by the API are sent to the server. Remaining
parameters are applied to the fetched results. With this
`allow_unknown_params` parameter of the list call is dropped.

Change-Id: Ie9cfb81330d6b98b97b7abad9cf5ae6334ba12e7

commit_message:
Use hacluster.add_location()

This change removes the workaround that was needed when the hacluster
interface didn't have a method to define colocations.

Related-Bug: #1880644
Change-Id: I4236cb4784062807d53381380d9d161ce2f450ee
(cherry picked from commit f2d9ed37090607676c5c6b54ea797c55e228d2af)

commit_message:
[oslo] Create zed branch for client and non-client libs

This creates the stable/zed branch for all client and non-client
libraries now that we are past the lib freeze on September 1st.

If the team wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the
library, someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or
update that patch with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 9th.

Change-Id: Ie6c4f31cd43ed46f017c954599d76c5e7f34cf67

subject: Allow plugging port when device_id is instance_id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-25 13:53:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutron.py'], 'message': 'Allow plugging port when device_id is instance_id

If the port is already having a device_id, it may be because the port
was created on neutron side with a device_id.
In such case, if the device_id is identical to the instance_id, we
should allow plugging that port.

Related-bug: 1986969

Change-Id: I0f9fa7b9e8e0dedf55e4df42514e0cf4bec47cc4
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Allow plugging port when device_id is instance_id

If the port is already having a device_id, it may be because the port
was created on neutron side with a device_id.
In such case, if the device_id is identical to the instance_id, we
should allow plugging that port.

Related-bug: 1986969

Change-Id: I0f9fa7b9e8e0dedf55e4df42514e0cf4bec47cc4
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>

subject: Clarify the erlang scheduler options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-09 08:06:40.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/other/rabbitmq.rst'], 'message': 'Clarify the erlang scheduler options

Depending on how erlang is started the options need to be passed with a
minus or a plus character. As this is not completely obvious we point
this out in our docs.

Change-Id: Iabedb7a132d743e40cb6253b1985076219128c84
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify the erlang scheduler options

Depending on how erlang is started the options need to be passed with a
minus or a plus character. As this is not completely obvious we point
this out in our docs.

Change-Id: Iabedb7a132d743e40cb6253b1985076219128c84

commit_message:
Set ignore_basepython_conflict (fixes confusing pep8 message)

Automatic envs (pyXX) will only use the python version appropriate to
that env and ignore basepython inherited from [testenv] if we set
ignore_basepython_conflict.

Closes-Bug: #1989106

Change-Id: I9ddc3631e1ae9491a42c946ec7bd124535536478

commit_message:
Add new novaplug mechanism driver

This new mechanism driver will do a call to nova client in order to
attach the port to a an instance when device_id is given on port
creation.

subject: Fix compatibility with oslo.db 12.1.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-09-08 23:30:41.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/db/api.py'], 'message': "Fix compatibility with oslo.db 12.1.0

oslo.db 12.1.0 has changed the default value for the 'autocommit'
parameter of 'LegacyEngineFacade' from 'True' to 'False'. This is a
necessary step to ensure compatibility with SQLAlchemy 2.0. However, we
are currently relying on the autocommit behavior and need changes to
explicitly manage sessions. Until that happens, we need to override the
default.

Change-Id: I502e42d1188a5273d030d50aff310d16916b0e17
Signed-off-by: Ayumu Ueha <ueha.ayumu@fujitsu.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix compatibility with oslo.db 12.1.0

oslo.db 12.1.0 has changed the default value for the 'autocommit'
parameter of 'LegacyEngineFacade' from 'True' to 'False'. This is a
necessary step to ensure compatibility with SQLAlchemy 2.0. However, we
are currently relying on the autocommit behavior and need changes to
explicitly manage sessions. Until that happens, we need to override the
default.

Change-Id: I502e42d1188a5273d030d50aff310d16916b0e17
Signed-off-by: Ayumu Ueha <ueha.ayumu@fujitsu.com>

subject: Make _get_dvr_subnet_ids_on_host_query return subnet ids
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 8313, 'name': 'Lajos Katona', 'display_name': 'lajoskatona', 'email': 'katonalala@gmail.com', 'username': 'elajkat', 'status': 'Eicsson Software Technologies'}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13861, 'name': 'yatin', 'email': 'ykarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'yatinkarel'}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2022-09-08 15:58:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_dvrscheduler_db.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/objects/test_quota.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/services/l3_router/test_l3_dvr_router_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Make _get_dvr_subnet_ids_on_host_query return subnet ids

_get_dvr_subnet_ids_on_host_query method was returning a
query object with an active db session, this resulted
into functional test failure where update_port was
called after that method as it's not allowed to run
a transaction with an active db session.
This got uncovered with oslo.db 12.1.0 release
which dropped autocommit.

To handle updated the method to return subnet ids instead
of the db query with active db context.

Also updated method name as it no longer returns
query object.

Additionally fix two other functional tests:-
- test_get_total_reservations_map by adding a db reader context
  for get_total_reservations_map call
- _TestIsSessionActive by calling neutron.objects.network as it looks
  for active session and since now autocommit is False for active
  session we need to have _connections[1] in transaction object.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/843256

Closes-Bug: #1989057
Change-Id: Ic818d5238ed86cef4621414512311179563ef1f5
"}]
commit_message:
Make _get_dvr_subnet_ids_on_host_query return subnet ids

_get_dvr_subnet_ids_on_host_query method was returning a
query object with an active db session, this resulted
into functional test failure where update_port was
called after that method as it's not allowed to run
a transaction with an active db session.
This got uncovered with oslo.db 12.1.0 release
which dropped autocommit.

To handle updated the method to return subnet ids instead
of the db query with active db context.

Also updated method name as it no longer returns
query object.

Additionally fix two other functional tests:-
- test_get_total_reservations_map by adding a db reader context
  for get_total_reservations_map call
- _TestIsSessionActive by calling neutron.objects.network as it looks
  for active session and since now autocommit is False for active
  session we need to have _connections[1] in transaction object.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/843256

Closes-Bug: #1989057
Change-Id: Ic818d5238ed86cef4621414512311179563ef1f5

subject: swift-manage-shard-ranges: add 'merge' subcommand
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-08-30 12:00:58.000000000', 'files': ['swift/cli/manage_shard_ranges.py', 'test/unit/cli/test_manage_shard_ranges.py', 'test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': "swift-manage-shard-ranges: add 'merge' subcommand

Adds a subcommand to swift-manage-shard-ranges that allows arbitrary
shard ranges to be read from a file and merged into a container
DB. The file should be a JSON serialized list of dicts.

The merge subcommand is only recommended for emergency shard range

Change-Id: Ic9ffcc042399f3834027a7935b64292d1fffe8d5
"}]
commit_message:
swift-manage-shard-ranges: add 'merge' subcommand

Adds a subcommand to swift-manage-shard-ranges that allows arbitrary
shard ranges to be read from a file and merged into a container
DB. The file should be a JSON serialized list of dicts.

The merge subcommand is only recommended for emergency shard range
manipulation by expert users.

Change-Id: Ic9ffcc042399f3834027a7935b64292d1fffe8d5

commit_message:
ShardRange: add is_child_of method

Adds an is_child_of method that infers the parent-child relationship
of two shard ranges from their names. This new method is limited to
use only under the same account.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2020-11-19 18:46:51.000000000', 'files': ['config/release/tripleo-ci/CentOS-7/promotion-testing-hash-stein.yml'], 'message': 'Use rdo trunk to get dlrn hash for promotions - stein

commit_message:
Use rdo trunk to get dlrn hash for promotions - stein

Using nodepool proxy mirrors leads to pulling
outdated hashes.  For promotions, we need to pull
the dlrn hash directly from rdo trunk.

Change-Id: I7334f4cb2021cd185b32c0e60080d5a558a580ef

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Idf4c35ac1b2169356eadd20fbf9b4f7ba0530c23

commit_message:
Add guide for configuring SSL certificates via charm options

Many OpenStack charms has config options which allows user to
configure charm certificates directly (without using Vault).
This guide describes the steps to accomplish it.

Closes-Bug: #1484489
Change-Id: I26cb0dbded691e9cdaaec6f56506576245d0bca6

subject: Refactor the Ceph NFS driver to use Cephadm NFS
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8056, 'name': 'Ramana Raja', 'email': 'rraja@redhat.com', 'username': 'Ram_Raja'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25402, 'name': 'Francesco Pantano', 'email': 'fpantano@redhat.com', 'username': 'fmount'}, {'_account_id': 29632, 'name': 'Carlos Eduardo', 'email': 'ces.eduardo98@gmail.com', 'username': 'silvacarlos'}, {'_account_id': 32594, 'name': 'Ashley Rodriguez', 'email': 'ashrod98@redhat.com', 'username': 'ashrod98'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-09-07 15:44:00.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/use-cephadm-nfs-ganesha-b9e071924de738fd.yaml', 'manila/share/drivers/cephfs/driver.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/cephfs/test_driver.py', 'manila/share/drivers/ganesha/manager.py', 'manila/share/drivers/ganesha/utils.py'], 'message': 'Refactor the Ceph NFS driver to use Cephadm NFS

CephAdmNFSProtocol helper has been added to allow users to consume NFS clusters
deployed using cephadm. This presents many advantages, since the operator
no longer needs to maintain their own instances of NFS Ganesha apart of the
Ceph cluster. For this, we now communicate with ceph mgr using
the nfs plugin. Read more about this plugin in
https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/cephfs/nfs/

Implements: bp/use-cephadm-nfs-ganesha

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1826f2970528928a31b32a664013380e38bbd7c9
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor the Ceph NFS driver to use Cephadm NFS

CephAdmNFSProtocol helper has been added to allow users to consume NFS clusters
deployed using cephadm. This presents many advantages, since the operator
no longer needs to maintain their own instances of NFS Ganesha apart of the
Ceph cluster. For this, we now communicate with ceph mgr using
the nfs plugin. Read more about this plugin in
https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/cephfs/nfs/

Implements: bp/use-cephadm-nfs-ganesha

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I1a7f8332bbb7fe9bcd48b62b6e7e8ae658dfad28
